unit_learning_outcomes.description: Evaluate and analyse concepts related to collaborative teamwork underpinning the education of individuals with unique capacities and needs
Promote inclusive practice in a range of environments from early childhood through to adulthood
Apply knowledge of the principles of access, participation, and supports to an individual’s circumstances
Outline criteria for appraisal of adjustments and accommodations to curriculum, assessment, teaching strategies, and learning environments that meet the needs of learners with sensory impairments
Demonstrate knowledge of relevant legislation underpinning inclusive practices
Critically analyse inclusive and collaborative practice by exploring contemporary social justice conceptual literature

enrolment_rules.description: Admission to MDisabilityStud or (EDST8301 and admission to MEd )

assessments.description: Develop a case study profile of an individual with sensory disability who is in transition.  (1500 words)
Develop a plan to support inclusion. (2000 words)

data.subject_search_title: SPED8911 - Inclusion and Professional Collaboration in Sensory Disability
data.description: This unit explores inclusive principles and practice that promote, protect and support the rights of people with sensory impairment to participate in  education and society, without discrimination and on the same basis as all people.
